description:
PyPy is a Python implementation, alternative to the standard CPython.
PyPy comes with a JIT (Just-in-Time compiler). We'll see the recent
developments:

-  PyPy now supports either Python 2.7 or (in beta) Python 3.5.

-  Numpy and the scientific stack are getting ever closer to fully
   working.

We will also mention a potential future direction: getting rid of the
GIL (Global Interpreter Lock). The Python community has been discussing
removing the GIL for a long time, with no success so far. Targeting PyPy
instead of CPython would still be quite involved, but more doable.
title: PyPy3, Numpy, and maybe a GIL-less future
